originalTitle: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
title: A Sad Day in Nigeria: Thinking of Our Friends
content:
Hello, Dear Friends!

Hello, my wonderful friends! Today, we have some important news from a country far away, in Africa, called Nigeria. Sometimes, news can be a little bit sad, but it's important to talk about it and understand it together. It's okay to feel sad or a little bit confused when we hear things like this. Grown-ups are here to help you understand and answer your questions.

What Happened in Nigeria?

In a place in Nigeria called Kaduna State, something happened that made many people sad. It was a Sunday, a special day for many people to go to church. Churches are places where people go to pray, sing songs, and learn good things together. They are usually very peaceful places where friends and families meet. But on this Sunday, some bad people came to two churches. These bad people took many churchgoers with them. "Churchgoers" are simply people who go to church. This means many moms, dads, grandmas, grandpas, and even some young people were taken away from their churches. This made everyone very, very worried. Did you know? Nigeria is a very big country in Africa! It has many different groups of people who speak lots of different languages, just like how you might speak English and maybe another language at home! Most people in Nigeria are very kind and friendly.

Where is Kaduna State?

Kaduna State is a special part of Nigeria, a bit like how your town is part of a bigger country. It has many towns and villages. The places where this sad event happened are called Kurmin Wali. Imagine your own town or village, and then imagine something sad happening there. That's how people in Kaduna State might be feeling right now. It's far away from many of us, but we can still think about the people there. It helps to know where places are on a map, even if we are not there ourselves. The world is a very big place with many different countries.

Who are the Churchgoers?

The people who were taken are called "churchgoers." They were just going about their normal Sunday, spending time in their places of worship. A "church service" is like a big gathering, where everyone comes together to sing, listen to stories, and pray. It's a time for community and peace. When someone is "kidnapped," it means bad people take them away without permission. This is a very serious thing, and it makes families worry a lot. Everyone is hoping that these people will come back safely to their homes and loved ones very soon. Did you know? There are many different types of churches around the world. Some are big, some are small, but they all share a common goal: to bring people together for prayer and community and to learn about good things.

Why Did This Happen?

Sometimes, bad people do bad things. We don't always know exactly why, but it's never okay. These bad people are sometimes called "armed gangs." "Armed" means they might have weapons, which is why grown-ups need to be very careful and the police are working hard. They don't have good reasons for taking people, and it makes everyone very upset and scared. Everyone wants the people who were taken to come back home safely to their families and friends. It's a very sad situation for many people.

What Are People Doing Now?

When something like this happens, many people start working very hard to help. The police in Nigeria are looking for the people who were taken. The "police" are special helpers who try to keep everyone safe and catch bad people. They are working hard to find where the churchgoers are and bring them back home. Also, many people in Nigeria and all over the world are praying. "Praying" means talking to God and asking for help, strength, and safety for everyone involved. They are asking for the people to be returned safely. Did you know? Police officers are heroes in many countries! They help people who are lost, keep roads safe, and try their best to stop bad things from happening. They work very hard for us all.

Working for Safety

Grown-ups everywhere work hard to make sure children and families are safe. When sad news like this happens, it can make us think about safety. It's important to remember that most places are safe, and most people are kind. There are always people watching out for you and trying to keep you from harm. This sad event is very unusual, and many people are focused on making sure it doesn't happen again. Many countries and communities work together to keep everyone secure. They want everyone to feel safe wherever they are. Did you know? Africa is a huge continent with 54 countries! Nigeria is just one of them. Each country has its own special stories, animals, and beautiful places to discover.

Why We Share This News

We share news like this not to scare you, but to help you understand what is happening in our big, wide world. It helps us to think about other people, even those far away. When we hear about sad things, it can remind us to be kind to each other, to help if we can, and to hope for good things to happen. It shows us that we are all part of one big family on Earth. Learning about the world helps us grow and understand different places and people. It also helps us appreciate the safety we often have.

Sending Our Love and Hope

So, our hearts are with the people of Kaduna State in Nigeria. We are thinking of the churchgoers who were taken and their families who are waiting for them. We hope the police find them very soon and that everyone returns home safe and sound. Let's all send our kind thoughts and wishes to Nigeria today. Remember to always be kind to those around you, because kindness makes our world a brighter place. We can all hope for a happy and safe return for everyone involved.
summary: Bad people in Nigeria took many churchgoers from two churches, and now everyone, including the police, is working hard and hoping they come home safely.
whyMatters: It's important because it reminds us to care about others, even far away, and to hope for safety and kindness for everyone in the world.

originalTitle: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus
title: Ethiopia's Big Water Party! Celebrating Timket!
content:
Hi, little friends! Your African news reporter is here! Have you ever been to a super big, happy party? Well, in a country called Ethiopia, there's a party that is really, really special. It's called Timket! Timket is a time when everyone in Ethiopia celebrates with lots of singing, dancing, and even splashing water. Imagine a whole country celebrating together! It's one of the most exciting times of the year for many people in Ethiopia. They get ready for days to make sure this festival is amazing. It's a joyful time for families and friends to come together and have fun, making happy memories.

What is Timket All About?

So, what is this big party for? Timket celebrates something very important for Christians. It's about when Jesus was baptized. "Baptized" means a special washing with water. It's like a very important bath or a blessing. Jesus was baptized in a river far away called the Jordan River. Many years ago, a man named John the Baptist put Jesus in the water. This was a very special moment for Christians. People in Ethiopia remember this important day with Timket. It's a way for them to show their love and faith, and to feel connected to this ancient story. **Did You Know?** Ethiopia is a beautiful country in Africa, just like where we live! It has amazing mountains, ancient churches, and friendly people who love to celebrate!

Getting Ready: The Night Before!

The Timket party doesn't just start on the big day. Oh no! The fun begins the night before! This special night is called "Ketera." People dress up in beautiful white clothes. White is a special color that means purity and happiness in their culture. Imagine seeing thousands of people all dressed in sparkling white, walking together! It looks like a long, bright river of happy people. They walk from their churches to a special place where water is found. This special place could be a river, a lake, or even a big pool made just for the celebration. Everyone is excited for what's coming.

The Special Parade

During Ketera, something very, very important happens. Priests carry something called a "Tabot." A Tabot is a special, holy replica of the Ark of the Covenant, which is like a very important treasure chest for Christians. Each church has its own Tabot. They are wrapped in fancy, colorful cloths and carried carefully on the priests' heads. Imagine seeing a parade of priests carrying these special treasures, with people singing and dancing all around them! It’s a truly amazing sight. The drums beat loudly, the people sing traditional songs, and the air is filled with excitement and cheer. **Did You Know?** The Tabots are so sacred and precious that most people are not allowed to see them directly. They are always covered with beautiful silk cloths and only the priests carry them!

The Big Morning Celebration!

When the sun comes up on the main Timket day, everyone is ready for the biggest part of the celebration! The priests pray and bless the water. They make the water holy and special, just like the water in the Jordan River. Then, people go to the water. Some people dip themselves in the water. It’s like a special shower or a blessing! Others might just get sprinkled with the holy water by the priests. It reminds them of Jesus being baptized and makes them feel close to God. The water feels cool and fresh, and it makes everyone feel happy and blessed.

Lots of Music and Dance!

Oh, the music! Timket is full of wonderful sounds that make your feet want to dance. There are drums beating a happy, strong rhythm that you can feel in your chest. People sing traditional songs, called "mezmur," with all their hearts. Young people and old people dance together, their bodies moving in joyful steps that have been passed down for many, many years. Imagine everyone clapping their hands, singing loudly, and moving to the beat of the drums! It’s impossible not to feel joyful and celebrate. The energy is just contagious, making everyone smile and laugh.

Food and Fun with Family!

After all the special ceremonies and dancing, it's time for more fun! Families gather together to eat delicious food. Ethiopian food is so tasty and special! They might have "injera," which is a soft, spongy bread that you eat with your hands, along with yummy stews called "wot." It's a time for everyone to share meals, laugh, and spend time with their loved ones. Children play games, and friends catch up on all their news. It's a wonderful day to feel close to your family and community, sharing love and happiness. The food is often prepared for days leading up to the festival, showing how much everyone looks forward to it. **Did You Know?** Injera is made from a tiny grain called teff, which is only grown in places like Ethiopia! It's super healthy and yummy, and a big part of Ethiopian meals!

Why Timket is So Special

Timket is more than just a party; it’s a time when people remember their faith and feel connected to each other. It shows how important history and traditions are to the Ethiopian people. It’s a time of immense joy, hope, and community spirit. People come from all over Ethiopia, and even from other countries, to be a part of this amazing festival. It brings everyone together, young and old, to celebrate something truly meaningful. It reminds them of God's love and the special story of Jesus, making their faith stronger.

Our African Celebration

So, there you have it, friends! Timket in Ethiopia is a fantastic celebration of history, faith, and joy. It’s a wonderful example of how people in Africa celebrate their beliefs with so much energy and happiness. It shows us how beautiful traditions can be and how important it is to remember special stories from the past, year after year. Next time you think of Ethiopia, imagine the sounds of drums, the sight of thousands of people in white clothes, and the joy of a big water party! What a beautiful way to celebrate an important event! Keep celebrating, Africa!
summary: Timket is a very big and happy festival in Ethiopia where people celebrate Jesus' baptism with singing, dancing, special water blessings, and parades of priests carrying holy objects.
whyMatters: This festival is important because it brings people together to celebrate their faith and history, showing the world a beautiful and joyful African tradition that teaches about community and love.

content: BBC Africa Eye joins an anti-trafficking police unit in Sierra Leone helping a man look for his missing children.

originalTitle: Man City sign Guehi from Palace - what will he bring?
title: Big News! A Super Defender Joins Manchester City!
content:
Hello, hello, my amazing little football fans all across Africa! Your friend, Reporter Rudo, is here with some super exciting news from the world of football! Grab your favourite football, find a comfy spot, and let's talk about some big news!

A Big Hello to Marc!

Imagine your favourite football team getting a brand new, super talented player! Well, that's exactly what has happened with a very famous team called Manchester City. They have just welcomed a wonderful football player named Marc Guehi! Can you say his name with me? Marc Gwe-hee! He is a really, really good player, and he is now going to play for Manchester City. This is a very big deal in the world of football!

Who is Marc Guehi?

So, who is this amazing Marc Guehi? He is a strong young man who loves to play football, just like many of you! Before joining Manchester City, Marc was playing for another team called Crystal Palace. He was not just any player there; he was their *captain*! Do you know what a captain does? A captain is like the leader of the team on the field. They help their teammates, make sure everyone is playing well, and talk to the referee. It's a very important job, like being the leader of your class! Marc was very good at being a captain, showing everyone how to play fairly and with lots of effort. He is known for being very strong and clever when he plays.

What Does a Defender Do?

Marc Guehi plays a special position on the football field called a *defender*. A defender's job is super important! Imagine your goal is like a treasure chest, and the other team wants to score a goal, which means they want to take the treasure. The defenders are like the strong, brave guards protecting that treasure chest! They stop the other team from getting too close to their goal. They kick the ball away, block shots, and make sure their goalkeeper doesn't have too much work to do. Marc is one of the best defenders, which means he is very good at protecting his team's goal. He runs fast, tackles carefully, and always thinks about how to keep the ball away from his net.

Hello, Manchester City!

Now, let's talk about Manchester City. Have you heard of them? They are one of the most famous football teams in the whole wide world! They wear sky-blue jerseys, and they play in big, exciting stadiums. Manchester City has won many, many trophies, which are like big shiny cups that teams get for being the best. They have lots of super-talented players and a very smart coach. Their fans, people who love to watch them play, are all over the world, even right here in Africa! Getting a new player like Marc makes their team even stronger, which is super exciting for all their fans.

Why Did Marc Change Teams?

You might be wondering, "Why did Marc leave Crystal Palace to join Manchester City?" Well, in football, sometimes players move from one team to another. This is called a *transfer*. Manchester City really, really wanted Marc Guehi because they know how good he is. They believe he can help them win even more big games and even more trophies! When a player transfers, the new team pays money to the old team. It's like when you buy a new toy, you give money to the toy shop. For Marc, Manchester City paid about £20 million! That sounds like a lot of money, doesn't it? It is a huge amount! This money helps Crystal Palace find new players and improve their team too. So, it's a way for all the teams to keep getting better.

What Will Marc Bring to Man City?

So, what amazing things will Marc Guehi bring to his new team? First, he will bring his amazing *defending skills*. He will make the back of the team, where the defenders play, even stronger. This means it will be much harder for other teams to score goals against Manchester City. He is also a very good leader, remember he was a captain? This means he will help his new teammates, talk to them, and encourage them, even when the game is tough. He is also very calm and collected, even under pressure, which is a great quality for a football player. He works very hard, and he is always trying his best. This kind of energy and skill is very important for a team that wants to be the best.

Did You Know? Fun Football Facts!

* Did you know that football is the most popular sport in the world? Billions of people love to watch and play it! * Did you know that a football match is usually 90 minutes long, split into two halves of 45 minutes? That's a lot of running! * Did you know that the coach for Manchester City is named Pep Guardiola? He is one of the smartest coaches in the world, always coming up with clever plans for his team! * Did you know that the ball used in football is called a "soccer ball" in some countries, but mostly it's just a "football"? * Did you know that many famous African footballers have played in teams like Manchester City? They inspire so many young players like you! Marc Guehi himself has played for the England national team, which is a very big honour!

Excitement for the New Season!

Everyone at Manchester City, from the coach Pep Guardiola to all the fans, is super excited to see Marc Guehi play. He will be wearing their famous sky-blue shirt and running onto the big pitch to help his new team win. It's like getting a new superhero for your favourite comic book team! We wish Marc Guehi all the best at Manchester City. We know he will try his hardest and make his new team, and all his fans, very proud. Keep your eyes peeled for the new football season, my friends, because it's going to be packed with amazing football moments! That's all for now from your friend, Reporter Rudo! Keep cheering for your favourite teams and maybe one day, you too will be a famous football star! Bye-bye for now!
summary: A super strong defender named Marc Guehi, who was a captain at Crystal Palace, is now joining the famous football team, Manchester City, to help them win more games and trophies!
whyMatters: This is important because Man City will have an even stronger team with Marc protecting their goal, and Marc will get to play in very big matches, showing all his amazing skills to help his new team be the best!

content: Following Morocco's last-minute spot-kick miss in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sport asks if a Panenka is ever the right choice for a penalty.
